recipe.name: Kimchi Patty Melt
recipe.description: A bold twist on the classic patty melt featuring spicy caramelized kimchi, juicy beef patties, and Pepper Jack cheese, all sandwiched between perfectly toasted rye bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ripe kimchi, drained and roughly chopped

steps: In a small skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add chopped kimchi and sugar, cooking for 4-5 minutes until the liquid evaporates and the kimchi is caramelized. Set aside.

In a large bowl, mix ground beef with Worcestershire sauce until combined. Divide into 4 portions, shape into oblong patties (matching the size of the bread), and flatten. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tsp oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties in batches for 1-2 minutes per side, until browned but still juicy. Remove from skillet.
Spread mayonnaise on one side of each bread slice. Place 2 slices in the skillet, mayo-side down.
Add a slice of cheese, a beef patty, a portion of caramelized kimchi, another slice of cheese, and a second slice of bread (mayo-side up).
Cook over medium-low heat, pressing gently with a spatula or burger press, for 1-2 minutes until the bread is toasted and the cheese starts to melt.
Sprinkle with garlic salt on the top slice if desired. Flip and repeat on the other side.
Cut sandwiches in half diagonally and serve immediately, optionally with a cold dill pickle.
A little effort, a lot of flavorâ€”dig in and savor!
